intro: Trigonosciadium tuberosum, commonly known as the tuberous trigonoscia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a cluster, which are typical of the daisy family. It is known for its edible tubers, which are rich in starch and have been traditionally used by indigenous communities. Due to its ornamental value and nutritional properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and for local consumption.
